head-description: We aim to build a game industry that is fair, responsible and humane – a place where creativity and ethics go hand in hand.
head-keywords: ethical guidelines, ethics, game community, alt zone
og-description: Read Psyche's Royale Gaming's ethical principles for players, team members and partners.
intro-description: We aim to build a game industry that is fair, responsible and humane – a place where creativity and ethics go hand in hand. We want our players, creators and partners to trust that we act transparently, responsibly and with respect for one another.
players-description:
• We develop games that provide a fair, fun and meaningful experience for all players.
• We respect player privacy and handle personal data responsibly and in accordance with data protection laws.
• We strive to create content that is appropriate for our audience and respects different backgrounds, cultures and values.
• We promote accessibility so that as many people as possible can enjoy our games.
employees-description:
• We support a healthy and sustainable work culture, avoiding overload and respecting individual well-being.
• We value diversity and equality in all our activities.
• We respect copyrights and give recognition to the contributions of every team member and volunteer.
business-description:
• We act openly and honestly in marketing and communication.
• Microtransactions and paid content are always presented clearly and transparently.
• We do not exploit player vulnerability or use manipulative game mechanics to drive spending.
society-description:
• We avoid stereotypical, discriminatory or offensive portrayals and aim to reinforce positive values.
• We consider environmental impact when developing and maintaining our games, as far as reasonably possible.
• We believe in the power of games to support learning, community and positive interaction.
law-description:
• We comply with all applicable laws and regulations, including data protection, copyright and consumer protection legislation.
• We are committed to transparency and taking responsibility for our actions.
• We actively listen to feedback from players, team members and partners to continuously improve our work.
